IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE AN ONLINE RESOURCE FOR THE GEOLOGICAL AND EARTH SCIENCES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BUILD A COMPREHENSIVE ONLINE RESOURCE FOR THE GEOLOGICAL AND EARTH SCIENCES.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION HAS BUILT A COMPREHENSIVE, WIDELY-ACCESSIBLE EASY TO USE ONLINE RESOURCE FOR PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS AS WELL AS BOOKS, FIELD GUIDES, MAPS, DATABASES AND OTHER INFORMATION RELATIVE TO THE GEOLOGICAL AND EARTH SCIENCES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, GSW HAS DOCUMENTED ITS CONSIDERATION OF ITS UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND HAS DETERMINED THAT NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS QUALITY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. GSW PERFORMED AN EVALUATION OF A CERTAIN TAX POSITION FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017 AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO MATERIAL MATTERS THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OR THAT MAY HAVE AN EFFECT ON ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. FORM 990 IS SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER IT IS FILED. AS SUCH, FORM 990 FOR THE FISCAL YEARS 2014 THROUGH 2016 REMAIN WITHIN THE STATUE OF LIMITATIONS.

ALEXANDRA VANCE PARTICIPATES IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NON-QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN AND WAS ALLOCATED NO EMPLOYER CONTRIBUTIONS AND $2,425 OF INVESTMENT EARNINGS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR. CHRISTOPHER STRAUB PARTICIPATES IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NON-QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN AND WAS ALLOCATED NO EMPLOYER CONTRIBUTIONS AND $1,968 OF INVESTMENT EARNINGS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.
DISCRETIONARY PAYMENTS MAY BE PAID TO NON-COMMISSIONED STAFF MEMBERS BASED ON MERIT. SUCH PAYMENTS ARE PRE-APPROVED BY THE GEOSCIENCEWORLD BOARD.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE GEOLOGICAL SOCIETY OF LONDON RECEIVES PUBLISHER ROYALTIES FROM GEOSCIENCEWORLD. THE ROYALTIES ARE CALCULATED IN THE SAME MANNER AS ALL OTHER PUBLISHERS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: MANAGING EDITOR OF A JORNAL PUBLISHED BY THE MINERALOGICAL SOCIETY OF AM.
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE MINERALOGICAL SOCIETY OF AMERICA RECEIVES PUBLISHER ROYALTIES FROM GEOSCIENCEWORLD. THE ROYALTIES ARE CALCULATED IN THE SAME MANNER AS ALL OTHER PUBLISHERS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: DIRECTOR OF COMMUNICATIONS AND TECHNOLOGY FOR AGI
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE AMERICAN GEOSCIENCES INSTITUTE RECEIVES PUBLISHER ROYALTIES FROM GEOSCIENCEWORLD. THE ROYALTIES ARE CALCULATED BASED ON SALES OF GEOREF.
THE GEOLOGICAL SOCIETY OF AMERICA RECEIVES PUBLISHER ROYALTIES FROM GEOSCIENCEWORLD. THE ROYALTIES ARE CALCULATED IN THE SAME MANNER AS ALL OTHER PUBLISHERS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: EXECUTIVE DIR. OF SOCIETY OF ECONOMIC GEOLOGY
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE SOCIETY OF ECONOMIC GEOLOGY RECEIVES PUBLISHER ROYALTIES FROM GEOSCIENCEWORLD. THE ROYALTIES ARE CALCULATED IN THE SAME MANNER AS ALL OTHER PUBLISHERS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF PETROLEUM GEOLOGISTS REPRESENTATIVE
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF PETROLEUM RECEIVES PUBLISHER ROYALTIES FROM GEOSCIENCEWORLD. THE ROYALTIES ARE CALCULATED IN THE SAME MANNER AS ALL OTHER PUBLISHERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS ELECTED BY THE ADVISORY COUNCIL. THE ADVISORY COUNCIL CONSISTS OF UP TO ONE MEMBER FROM EACH PUBLISHER ORGANIZATION THAT LICENSES CONTENT TO GEOSCIENCE WORLD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO FILING, FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD AND DISCUSSED AT A BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GSW HAS THE BOARD AND EMPLOYEES ANNUALLY SIGN AND ACKNOWLEDGE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDEPENDENT BOARD MEMBERS REVIEW COMPARABILITY DATA AND DOCUMENT THEIR APPROVAL OF THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS ON A REGULAR BASIS. AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE DISCUSSED AND APPROVED AT A BOARD MEETING. THE AUDIT ITSELF IS OVERSEEN BY THE CEO/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND COO/DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WITH REGULAR UPDATES TO THE BOARD AND IN CONSULTATION WITH THE BOARD TREASURER. THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE DRAFT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
